Thank You extremezone for all your superb uploads!  As a 100% disabled combat wounded veteran with PTSD, Panic Disorder, Agoraphobia, Nerve damage, and Degenerative disc disease, living on disability, you have helped make my quality of live a bit better.  As I cannot go out to the store or the movie theaters or anywhere else for that matter, you have helped keep my mind off things with great quality movies. I guess that the majority of the people who have commented negatively on this movie suffers from close to non-existing intelligence.

This movie is a masterpiece and simply put a work of art. From the CC of the film (which suits perfectly to this "judgement day scenery" to the audio and soundtrack, it's technically by far the best film of the year.

And the cast didn't let the technical side down. They worked VERY well together. Denzel is awesome  as well, Mila is getting better for every film and Gary Oldman is great as the "baddy".

The story is probably not ALL that original, but still original enough to keep one seated for the entire film. I found it to be brilliant.


Even though I haven't watched Inception yet, I still consider this to be the best film this year and I'm highly recommending it to anyone with more neurons than the average showed on these pages.

Go watch Operation Endgame or Toystory 3 instead haters, that'll probably suit your intelligence better!

pleblian, I find it funny that you call me religious. In fact, you calling me "a religious fanatic" is probably the joke of the year.


I'm baptized and that's it. I didn't confirm "the belief" when I was 14 (as the only one of my mates).

Moreover, I see religion as an excuse. An excuse, that some (allright, a lot) need in their life to have so when they fuck up (and they will), they can turn to their religion and say that it's "Gods" way etc.



Even though I often proclaim that "Religion is the root of all evil" I must say, that I CAN see beauty of the 10 commandments, but that's more due to the morality.


Anyway, what I was trying to say was that you couldn't be anymore off than you are, when you're calling me religious. It's an awesome film with an awesome cast, it's hands down the best film of the year, although Shutter Island is up there too.

As others might have pointed out already, Denzel's a muslim, he plays a christian in the film. That's another effing "brilliant" aspect of this film.
